Annie Murphy reports.

Camp Hope, the tent city that sits near the San Jose mine, has swelled in recent days.
This baked, remote piece of earth is packed with campers and motor homes, tents, and people.
And since one of the drills finally reached the miners, it's buzzing with activity.
Press and government officials pour in and out of the camp; busloads of more family members and close friends are arriving, and the air vibrates with the sound of generators.
Like everyone here, Coralia Alarcon was thrilled to hear that the drill had reached the spot where her husband, Franklin Lobos, and the other miners are trapped.
All the same, she says she's still nervous and won't be at ease until Lobos reaches the surface.
